>
[Shauth Blade](/Weapons.aspx?ID=157)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Abomination Vaults</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=170" />
<trait label="Deadly d8" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=174" />
<trait label="Finesse" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=179" />
<trait label="Versatile P" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=200" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death](/Sources.aspx?ID=81) pg. 73</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 2 gp

**Damage** 1d4 S

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Martial

**Group** [Knife](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=9)
</row>

</column>

---

These strange curved blades are jagged and deadly weapons made from the alchemically strengthened teeth of dead urdefhans. Each weapon is typically named for the [urdefhan](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=158) whose teeth were forged into the weapon, which are often carried (and revered) by that urdefhan's descendants. Magical shauth blades allow an urdefhan wielder to channel their Wicked Bite ability through shauth blade Strikes.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).
